document.docAuthor: Çiplak, Battal, Heller, Klaus-Gerhard & Demirsoy, Ali
document.masterDocTitle: Review and key to species of Platycleis from Turkey (Orthoptera: Tettigoniidae) with descriptions of Yalvaciana subgen. n. and two new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review and key to species of Platycleis from Turkey (Orthoptera: Tettigoniidae) with descriptions of Yalvaciana subgen. n. and two new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Syntypes of both sexes: FRANCE , Montpellier and Chateau-Gombert (lost)
.
Distribution. Mediterranean region and adjacent parts of Europe and Asia up to China .

Remarks.
Platycleis intermedia mesopotamica Ramme, 1927
diOEers from the nominate subspecies by two swellings on the VI sternite of female, somewhat as seen in the VII sternite. It was recorded from south-eastern Anatolia ( Ramme, 1951 ; KarabagÏ, 1958). However, two subspecies,
intermedia intermedia
and
intermedia mesopotamica
, are often recorded from the same localities (KarabagÏ, 1958). During this study, females with modi®ed and unmodi®ed VI sternite were observed at the same localities (e.g. Malatya , KahramanmarasË). However, the specimens from Mesopotamian part of Turkey (Diyarbakõr and SËanlõurfa) show the character of the nominate subspecies and this character does not occur as consistent variation in Anatolian population. Additionally, the protuberances of VI sternite are indistinct in Anatolian population and well developed in type specimens. Thus, all specimens included in this study belong to
P. intermedia intermedia
.

Turkish sound record.
Naskrecki and Otte (1999b) OSF online
11 August 1999
; the characteristic song of
P. intermedia
was observed at the following localities: Bursa , Ulufer CË ayõ south of UludagÏ, 400 and
800 m
; Erzurum , pass north-west of IÇspir,
1400 m
; Erzurum , CË oruh valley 35 km north-east of IÇspir,
900 m
(Heller, unpublished data)
.

Previous records for Turkey .
This species has been recorded from many localities in Turkey (for old records see KarabagÏ, 1958; KarabagÏ et al ., 1971, 1981; Demirsoy, 1975; Salman, 1978; Harz, 1983 ; Naskrecki, 1991 ; Naskrecki and U È nal, 1995; CË õplak et al ., 1996).

caption.paragraph:
FIGS 13±20.
Platycleis (Incertana) .
(13±16)
P. incerta
: (13) male cercus, (14) titillators, (15) female VII sternite and subgenital plate, (16) male anal tergite. (17±20)
P. persica
: (17) male cercus, anal tergite and subgenital plate, (18) titillators, (19) female VII sternite and subgenital plate, (20) ovipositor (®gure 14 from Ramme, 1951 ; ®gures 17±20 from Salman, 1978). Scale 1 mm.
